thread.title: Figmints Digital Creative Marketing and North Star Announce Merger

author: cnbc.com
title: Figmints Digital Creative Marketing and North Star Announce Merger

organizations.name: figmints digital creative marketing and north star announce merger two

text:
Two leading RI-based creative agencies join together to impact marketing and sales departments across the country.
PAWTUCKET, R.I.--(BUSINESS WIRE)-- James Kwon, CEO of Pawtucket-based Figmints and April Williams, President of North Kingstown-based North Star, both faith-based companies, announced today they joined forces on May 1, 2018 to offer a fully integrated inbound/outbound approach to marketing that will impact how marketing and sales departments work together to drive revenue.
North Star, a sales amplification company, has been known for over 20 years for its focus on creative outbound marketing that drives revenue. They have developed two leading B2B sales and growth offerings, SalesAmp and SalesXsell, that use proven outbound marketing approaches combined with inside sales support to drive sales for individual salespeople.
“Over the past 21 years, I have focused on getting marketing and sales departments aligned to make marketing work for sales. Joining with Figmints is the exciting next step for that mission. Bringing developers, designers, and digital marketing to our SalesAmp process will allow us to scale and support marketing and sales teams with even greater results,” said April Williams, President and Visionary of North Star.
Since 1999, Figmints has become known as one of the premier brand and digital agencies in New England, with an exceptional talent to awaken company’s stories that needed to be told. As HubSpot’s ambassador partner in RI, they have differentiated themselves from the crowd through innovative online strategies with streamlined, consistent creative execution of digital marketing, web design and development, branding, and video.
“We get really excited when we get to help companies and organizations tell stories worth sharing,” said James Kwon, CEO of Figmints. “We craft these stories visually through branding, establishing them on the web, and driving the right audience to listen carefully. The biggest impact is when we connect these stories in a way that it improves the bottom line, and shows how a predictable funnel can change the way a business views marketing. It’s been incredible to watch what God is doing in our companies, and having April and her team with us is an exciting next step towards how we get to serve our clients together.”
Both companies will be located at the current Figmints address:
Location: 163 Exchange St, #101, Pawtucket, RI 02860
Websites: www.figmints.com and www.fortheloveofmarketing.com
